info.title: atf-server
info.description: This API describes the communication protocol between client and server for a party contest.

put.description: Allows changing the password of the current logged in user.

post.description:
This endpoint allows requesting the resetting of an account's password given the user has access to the email account used to register this account.

The process involves sending an email address to this endpoint, which, if existing, will trigger the system sending an email with a one time token to reset the account to that address.

For security reasons this endpoint will answer 202 Accepted in any case, whether the email is in the system or not, to prevent enumeration attacks. If the object receive does not contain a valid email address or does not contain one at all, the answer will be 400 Bad Request.

put.description:
This endpoint allows finishing the password reset process. The token received by email is sent on the path. A new password for the user is passed in the body of the request.

A 200 OK status code will indicate the lifetime of the used token is expired and the password has been set to the new value.

A 400 Bad Request will be produced if the body is invalid, be it that the password is not accepted as valid or that the body doesn't conform to the specification.

A 404 Not Found response will indicate that the introduced token is not a valid token generated by the system.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Password reset token received by the user via email.

get.description: Gives access to the current contest ranking.

post.description: Create a new user in the system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier for an entity in the system, passed as a path parameter.

get.description: Gives a historic record of the user's attendance confirmations to parties, and subsequent scoring, sorted in descending chronological order.
Lists all announcements currently visible. That is, announcements active at the present time for anonymous and normal users and all existing announcements for admin users.

post.description: Creates a new announcement. This endpoint is only available to authenticated users.

get.description: Gets data about an announcement given its ID.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to create a party resource. Note it is assymetrical, since parties, once created, include much denormalized information, useful on presenting them on screen.

This endpoint will receive a PartyCreation object and return a full Party object.

requestBody.description: The confirmation creation, including an ID and the confirmation image as payload in multipart/form-data.

post.description: Confirms the assistance to a party of one or more participants by creating a confirmation object.

get.description: List all attendance confirmations submitted for a certain party.
Gets a confirmation given its ID.

post.summary: Add user to an attendance confirmation photo
post.description: Allows to add an user to a confirmation photo. Upon addition, the confirmation object is returned.

delete.description: Removes an user from an attendance confirmation photo. Upon removal, the confirmation object is returned.

post.description: Allows addition of new party types.

get.description: Gets an party type given its ID.

delete.description: Removes a party type given its ID.

post.description: Allows addition of new bonus types.

get.summary: Get extra bonus type by ID
get.description: Gets an extra bonus type given its ID.

delete.summary: Delete extra bonus type by ID
delete.description: Removes an extra bonus type given its ID.

post.description: Allows addition of new bonus types.

get.summary: Get extra bonus type by ID
get.description: Gets an extra bonus type given its ID.

delete.summary: Delete extra bonus type by ID
delete.description: Removes an extra bonus type given its ID.

count.description: Number of elements in this page.

total.description: Total number of elements in the collection.

first.description: Link to the first page of this collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page of this collection. Only present if there is a previous page.

next.description: Link to the next page of this collection. Only present if there is a next page.

last.description: Link to the last page of this collection.

start.description: Number of the item at the start of this page. Only present if the page is not empty.

finish.description: Number of the item at the end of this page. Only present if the page is not empty.

RankingCollectionResponse.title: RankingCollectionResponse
RankingCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for raking requests. Includes ranking data and paging metadata.

data.description: The ranking information sorted by rank.

Ranking.title: Ranking
Ranking.description: Represents a position on the contest's ranking, always held by an user.

position.description: Number of the position in the ranking.

variation.description: Represents the user's variation in rank after the last update. Possible values are RISES, STAYS and FALLS.

UserCollectionResponse.title: UserCollectionResponse
UserCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for user list requests. Includes user profile data and paging metadata.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents publicly available information about an user.

victories.description: Number of times this participant has won the contest.

UserCreation.title: UserCreation
UserCreation.description: Represents information about an user. This model is used for creating a new user in the system.

AnnouncementCollectionResponse.title: AnnouncementCollectionResponse
AnnouncementCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for announcement list requests. Includes announcement data and paging metadata.

Announcement.title: Announcement
Announcement.description: An announcement is a party proposal that a user can create.

date.description: Date (to day precission only) of this announcement.

AnnouncementCreation.title: AnnouncementCreation
AnnouncementCreation.description: An announcement is a party proposal that a user can create. This is the model for announcement creation. It's different for the complete announcement data in that it doesn't need to include the user, which will be obtained from the session information.

date.description: Date (to day precission only) of this announcement.

location.description: Geographical location of this announcement. Unique textual identifier for Google's Places API.

PartyCollectionResponse.title: PartyCollectionResponse
PartyCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for party list requests. Includes party data and paging metadata.

Party.title: Party
Party.description: Represents a party. Includes information of announcement and confirmations.

PartyCreation.title: PartyCreation
PartyCreation.description: Model used to create a party object from an announcement. It only includes necessary data.

PartyTypeCollectionResponse.title: PartyTypeCollectionResponse
PartyTypeCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for party type list requests. Includes party type data and paging metadata.

PartyType.title: PartyType
PartyType.description: Describes the possible types of parties.

name.description: Short name of this party type

points.description: Base points granted by this party type

ConfirmationCollectionResponse.title: ConfirmationCollectionResponse
ConfirmationCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for attendance confirmation list requests. Includes confirmation data and paging metadata.

Confirmation.title: Confirmation
Confirmation.description: Confirm the attendance of a certain amount of users to a party.

photo.description: Pictorial evidence of the assistance of a group of people to a convened party.

attenders.description: List of user IDs of those present in the picture.

ConfirmationCreation.title: ConfirmationCreation
ConfirmationCreation.description: Confirm the attendance of a certain amount of users to a party. This is the model for the creation of a confirmation resource.

Attendance.title: Attendance
Attendance.description: Represents the joining of a user and the extras gained by them by attending a certain party.

extras.description: List of extras included with this attendance.

points.description: Points earned by the user by this attendance.

AttendanceCreation.title: AttendanceCreation
AttendanceCreation.description: Represents the joining of a user and the extras gained by them by attending a certain party. Model used for creating attendance entries in a confirmation object, using only IDs of referenced data.

extraIds.description: List of extras included with this attendance.

ExtraCollectionResponse.title: ExtraCollectionResponse
ExtraCollectionResponse.description: Paged collection response for extra scoring list requests. Includes extra scoring data and paging metadata.

Extra.title: Extra
Extra.description: Represents a scoring bonus given to a user for attendance to a certain party.

OfficialPartyCollectionReponse.title: OfficialPartyCollectionResponse
OfficialPartyCollectionReponse.description: Paged collection response for official party list requests. Includes official party data and paging metadata.

OfficialParty.title: OfficialParty
OfficialParty.description: Model for an official party, having special scoring scheme for its duration.

location.description: Geographical location of this official party. Unique textual identifier for Google's Places API.

startDate.description: Starting date of this official party.

duration.description: Number of days this official party takes place.

PasswordChange.title: PasswordChange
PasswordChange.description: Model to allow the user to change the password of their account.

PasswordResetRequest.title: PasswordResetRequest
PasswordResetRequest.description: Allows someone to request a password reset for an account.

PasswordReset.title: PasswordReset
PasswordReset.description: Send in a new password for the user.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Number of elements to return in a collection request.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Number of elements to skip in a collection request.

idParameter.name: id
idParameter.description: Identifier for an entity in the system, passed as a path parameter.

idPartyParameter.name: party
idPartyParameter.description: Identifier for a party, passed as a path parameter.

idConfirmationParameter.name: confirmation
idConfirmationParameter.description: Identifier for an attendance confirmation, passed as a path parameter.

ifNoneMatchHeader.name: If-None-Match
ifNoneMatchHeader.description: The If-None-Match HTTP request header makes the request conditional. For GET and HEAD methods, the server will send back the requested resource, with a 200 status, only if it doesn't have an ETag matching the given ones. For other methods, the request will be processed only if the eventually existing resource's ETag doesn't match any of the values listed.

ifMatchHeader.name: If-Match
ifMatchHeader.description: The If-Match HTTP request header makes the request conditional. For GET and HEAD methods, the server will send back the requested resource only if it matches one of the listed ETags. For PUT and other non-safe methods, it will only upload the resource in this case.

eTagHeader.description: The ETag HTTP response header is an identifier for a specific version of a resource. It lets caches be more efficient and save bandwidth, as a web server does not need to resend a full response if the content has not changed. Additionally, etags help prevent simultaneous updates of a resource from overwriting each other mid-air collisions).
